event.title: held village status for eight years

data.event: It held village status for eight years between 1923 and 1931, and was recognized as a hamlet prior to annexation by Drumheller in 1967.

event.title: was recognized as a hamlet prior to annexation by Drumheller in 1967

data.event: It held village status for eight years between 1923 and 1931, and was recognized as a hamlet prior to annexation by Drumheller in 1967.

event.title: was incorporated as a village on March 16, 1923

data.event: Newcastle was incorporated as a village on March 16, 1923.

event.title: dissolved from village status on May 21, 1931

data.event: It subsequently dissolved from village status on May 21, 1931.

event.title: was eventually annexed by the former City of Drumheller from the former Municipal District of Badlands No. 7 (then Improvement District No. 7) in 1967

data.event: Newcastle was eventually annexed by the former City of Drumheller from the former Municipal District of Badlands No. 7 (then Improvement District No. 7) in 1967.
Despite its dissolution in 1931, the former village grew to a population of 1,278 in 1936 and peaked at a population of 1,317 in 1951.
Despite its dissolution in 1931, the former village grew to a population of 1,278 in 1936 and peaked at a population of 1,317 in 1951.

event.title: declined to a population of 960 in 1966

data.event: It then declined to a population of 960 in 1966.
